display_name_template: Community Facilities, Public Realm, and Social Infrastructure for {app_name}
description_long: Assessment of the provision of, or impact on, community facilities (e.g., schools, healthcare, open space, leisure), the quality of public realm, and contributions to social infrastructure.
sub_questions: What new or improved community facilities are proposed as part of the development?
How does the proposal address any identified deficiencies in local community infrastructure?
What is the quantum and quality of public open space provided, and does it meet local standards?
How does the design of the public realm enhance connectivity, safety, and visual amenity?
Are financial contributions (S106/CIL) proposed for off-site infrastructure, and are these justified and policy compliant?
Has the impact on existing local services (e.g., school capacity, GP surgeries) been assessed and addressed?
typical_positive_impacts: Provision of needed new community facilities or public open space.
Significant improvements to the public realm.
Appropriate financial contributions mitigating impact on local services.
Enhanced sense of community and place.
Improved access to essential services for new and existing residents.
typical_negative_impacts: Failure to provide adequate community facilities or open space to meet the needs of the development.
Increased strain on existing local services without sufficient mitigation.
Poor quality or poorly designed public realm.
Insufficient developer contributions to address identified impacts.
Loss of existing valued community assets.
common_mitigation_measures: On-site provision of community facilities or open space.
Increased S106/CIL contributions based on robust needs assessment.
Phasing of development linked to infrastructure delivery.
Design revisions to improve public realm quality and integration.
Legal agreements to secure long-term management and maintenance of community assets.
